nodes.bodyText: These values of minQ and maxQ are really strange. It seems to be default values. What have we planned to do with default values management in IIDM ? Do we need a global strategy ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@
             <iidm:busBreakerTopology>
                 <iidm:bus id="B1" name="BUS-1   100" v="1.04" angle="0.0"/>
             </iidm:busBreakerTopology>
-            <iidm:generator id="B1-G" energySource="OTHER" minP="-1.7976931348623157E308" maxP="1.7976931348623157E308" voltageRegulatorOn="true" targetP="71.64102" targetV="1.04" targetQ="27.04592" bus="B1" connectableBus="B1">
+            <iidm:generator id="B1-G" energySource="OTHER" minP="-9999.0" maxP="9999.0" voltageRegulatorOn="true" targetP="71.64102" targetV="1.04" targetQ="27.04592" bus="B1" connectableBus="B1">
                 <iidm:minMaxReactiveLimits minQ="-99990.0" maxQ="999900.0"/>

nodes.bodyText:
This is min max double value. This is probably a bad design and we should reactive limit should be optional in the IIDM API to better handle to no reactive limit case.
Anyway it is not really the same topic as this PR, as reactive limits in a loadflow are not used to dispatch everything out of the limit like it is the case with active power.
